did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Case files, reports, and diaries and interrogation transcripts of Czech senior secret police personnel, relating to secret service activities in Czechoslovakia. Includes a summary of the secret police file on Václav Havel. Photocopies of originals in the Národní archiv.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection may not be copied until 2056 April 10.
Collection is otherwise open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2000.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Searchworks at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in 1969, Źáček earned his PhD in mass communication at Charles University, Prague in 2001. His dissertation topic was the illegal magazine "V Boj." From 1993 to 1997 he served as head of the Documentation Section, Office for the Documentation and Investigation of the Activities of the State Security Service/Crimes of Communism, and was editor of the anthology Securitas Imperii, a periodical concerned with state security documents and studies, from 1994 to 1999. In 1997 he became head of the team for the documentation of the role of Czechoslovak officials in Korea and Vietnam, in cooperation with the U.S. Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense for POW/Missing Personnel Affairs. In 1998 he was appointed deputy director, Office for the Documentation and Investigation of the Crimes of Communism, and then served as senior researcher at the Institute of Contemporary History, Academy of Sciences in Prague from 1999 to 2006. After a short period as acting director of the Security Services Archive from 2007 to 2008, Źáček was appointed director of the Institute for the Study of Totalitarian Regimes in January 2008. He was a visiting scholar at the Hoover Archives Summer Workshop on Soviet Communism in July 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Case files, reports, diaries, and interrogation transcripts of Czech senior secret police personnel, relating to secret service activities in Czechoslovakia. Includes a summary of the secret police file on Václav Havel. Contains personnel files on State Security agents, orders and plans, and reports from Ministry of Security X and II Directorates. Photocopies of originals in the Státní ústřední in Prague.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Secret service--Czechoslovakia.
Civil rights--Czechoslovakia.

scopecontent.p: Includes articles by Pavel Źáček, interrogation transcripts, and diaries of former security agents and Ministry of Interior notes

did.unittitle: "Státní Bezpecnost Kontra Václav Havel (1965-1968)," by Pavel Źáček,

scopecontent.p: Includes summary of Vaclav Havel's secret police file

did.unittitle: Articles on Státni Bezpečnost (StB) former agents, and other related articles, by Pavel Źáček, ,
"Vzestupy a pády Bohumíra Molnára. Kariéra generála Státní bezpečnosti," article by Pavel Źáček, . ("Rise and Fall of Bohumír Molnér. The Carrier of the General of State Security.")
Lt. Gen. Alojz Lorenc, First Deputy Minister of Interior, Prague,
Maj. Dr. Petr Zak, Chief of 10th Department Second Main Administration State Security, Prague,
Ing. František Kincl, Minister of Interior, Prague,
Ministry of Interior, notes about 1989 demonstration in Prague
Copies of diaries by former StB leaders,
Deputy Minister of Interior, Lt. Col. O. Sedlak,
Maj. Dr. Miroslav Chovanec, Deputy Chief of Second Main Administration of State Security,
Lt. Col. DR. Karel Vykypěl, Chief of Second Main Administration of State Security,
"Nástroj Triedneho Štátu. Organizácia Ministerstiev Vnitra a Bezpečnostných Zborov 1953-1990," edited by Pavel Źáček, ,

scopecontent.p: (The organization of the Ministries of Interior and the Security Forces)

did.unittitle: Organization of the Ministry of Interior of Czechoslovakia (MV)
Organization of Territorial Departments of the Ministry of Interior and National Security Corps (SNB),
Karta Prislusnika-Úřad pro Dokumentaci a Vyšetřováni (KP-UDV) Files,

scopecontent.p: Contains personnel files and registration cards of agents, from the Office for Documentation and Investigation. Most files are in an unidentified numerical order

did.unittitle: Seznam KP (List of personnel files, alphabetical),
Personnel characteristics and qualifications for the potential position as Chief of Public Security

scopecontent.p: Includes secret orders and guidelines from the Minister of Interior and Chiefs of State Security Divisions, related to national security issues, also Ministry of Interior bulletins (Věstníky). Also includes a list of "back-up" agents

did.unittitle: X-Správa Zbor Národní Bezpečnosti (ZNB) (Tenth Directorate of the National Security Council) files,

scopecontent.p: Contains analysis, statistics, reports, and guidelines about security issues, work plan evaluations (vyhodnocení plánu práce), reviews (informace), statements (vykazy), from various divisions

did.unittitle: Slovak Republic State Security SStB.SR (Bratislava, Banská Bystrica, Košice),
Czech Republic State Security SStB.ČR (Praha, Plzeň, Brno, Ostrava, České Budějovice, Hr. Králové),
Plány. FMV Provadeci plany (Federal Ministry of Interior work plans),
II-Správa Sbor Národní Bezpečnosti (SNB) (Second Directorate of the National Security Council) files,

scopecontent.p: Contains work plan evaluations (vyhodnocení plánu práce), reviews (informace), statements (vykazy), from various divisions, includes notes about discharging the Státní bezpečnost (StB) officers and lists of names

did.unittitle: List of names of StB officers,

scopecontent.p: Includes lists of names and detailed characteristics of StB agents, personal and professional CV files, questionnaires, evaluations, certificates, copies of photographs of agents and defectors. Arranged in two groups, alphabetical or by file number

did.unittitle: Foto StB (photos of State Security agents)
